etymology.description: Pictogram (象形) – fired earthenware pottery, or a tile.
etymology.interpretation: Originally a drawing of a curved clay tile or pottery shard, with the hooked bottom suggesting a lip or edge. The form was later regularized into straight strokes yet still evokes a fired earthenware piece.

examples.chinese: 屋顶上的瓦片被风刮落了(屋頂上的瓦片被風刮落了)。
examples.pinyin: Wūdǐng shàng de wǎpiàn bèi fēng guā luò le.
examples.english: The tiles on the roof were blown off by the wind.

examples.chinese: 工人正在铺瓦修屋顶(工人正在鋪瓦修屋頂)。
examples.pinyin: Gōngrén zhèngzài pū wǎ xiū wūdǐng.
examples.english: Workers are laying tiles to repair the roof.

examples.chinese: 这座老屋用青瓦白墙，很有江南风味(這座老屋用青瓦白牆，很有江南風味)。
examples.pinyin: Zhè zuò lǎowū yòng qīngwǎ báiqiáng, hěn yǒu Jiāngnán fēngwèi.
examples.english: This old house uses dark tiles and white walls, giving it a Jiangnan style.
